studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Reduction in the number of primary composite events required for the interim analysis from 540 to 405.
Addition of two new secondary endpoints (3-point MACE and hospitalized congestive heart failure) and reordering of the testing hierarchy.
Designation of pancreatitis and lower-extremity amputations as adverse events of special interest requiring 24-hour reporting.
Added exclusion criteria for subjects at high risk for lower extremity amputation.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Decrease the number of primary composite events required for the interim analysis from 540 to 405.
Internal and external data suggest beneficial effects on renal outcomes may be detected with fewer events.
Include new safety information and guidance regarding subject management surrounding the event of lower extremity amputations.
Slower than expected recruitment early in the study; sample size expanded to maintain study timeline.

studyChanges.summary: Reduced the number of subjects meeting the primary composite endpoint required for the interim analysis.

studyChanges.afterText: The subject is currently using disallowed therapy
studyChanges.summary: Updated language to accommodate subjects already using disallowed medications.
Clarified that study medication is discontinued when dialysis or transplant is initiated rather than just required.
Increased the upper limit of HbA1c level for study entry to allow patients with higher baseline values.
Increased total sample size due to recruitment rates.
